abstract: Apple overhauls its .Mac service and calls it MobileMe, an effort to synchronize in real time all of the data on all of your computers.
snippet: Apple overhauls its .Mac service and calls it MobileMe, an effort to synchronize in real time all of the data on all of your computers.
lead_paragraph: “Cloud computing” is a white-hot buzzword these days. It basically means working with files and programs that reside on the Internet, beyond your company’s walls — out there in the “cloud.”

headline.main: In Sync to Pierce the Cloud
headline.print_headline: In Sync To Pierce The Cloud

abstract: In a series of blog posts, Google has been explaining how its search engine works. It has a lot of technology that is meant to understand what users and Web pages actually mean, undercutting the idea that start-ups using “semantic search” technology will be able to build search engines that are “Google-killers”.

lead_paragraph: UPDATE | 5 PM 7/18 Riza C. Berkan, the chief executive of Hakia, offers his response to this post in a post on the Hakia blog.

headline.main: Google and the Real Search for Meaning on the Web
